messages.content: give me an image prompt of a scary alien

An image prompt of a scary alien:

Description: The alien has four long arms and legs with sharp claws. Its skin is a pale, sickly green and its eyes are glowing red. Its head is elongated and it has a large, gaping mouth filled with razor-sharp teeth. The alien is looming over a small, frightened human who is cowering in fear. In the background, there are ruins of a destroyed city and smoke rising from the wreckage. 

Image inspiration: https://www.pinterest.com/pin/564154633456523589/
what are some words that can be used to describe something scary

Here are some words that can be used to describe something scary:

1. Terrifying
2. Horrifying
3. Eerie
4. Suspenseful
5. Creepy
6. Disturbing
7. Dreadful
8. Spooky
9. Grisly
10. Unsettling
11. Menacing
12. Bone-chilling
13. Macabre
14. Frightening
15. Petrifying
16. Harrowing
17. Unnerving
18. Sinister
19. Hair-raising
20. Ghoulish.
what are some well-known alien movie franchises

Here are some well-known alien movie franchises:

1. Alien (1979) directed by Ridley Scott
2. Predator (1987) directed by John McTiernan
3. War of the Worlds (1953 & 2005) directed by Byron Haskin and Steven Spielberg respectively
4. The Thing (1982) directed by John Carpenter
5. Independence Day (1996) directed by Roland Emmerich
6. Men in Black (1997) directed by Barry Sonnenfeld
7. Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977) directed by Steven Spielberg
8. The War of the Planets (1977) directed by Antonio Margheriti
9. Star Trek (1979-2016) directed by various directors
10. The X-Files (1998-2008) directed by various directors
what does the term "in the doghouse" mean

The term "in the doghouse" means to be in trouble or to be unfavored with someone, typically a spouse or partner. It is usually used to describe a situation when someone is in disfavor or has done something wrong and is therefore being temporarily shunned or punished by their partner or family member. The phrase originated from the earlier times when people kept their dogs in separate kennels or doghouses, outside of the family home, and when a person was in disfavor, they would be sent out to the doghouse to sleep. Thus, being "in the doghouse" now means being relegated to a disfavored status, as if being sent out of the house to sleep with the dogs.
